chapter.title: Migrating and Upgrading
chapter.para: This section covers the supported migration and upgrading scenarios.

sect1.title: Migration from &slepos-old; 10 to &slepos-old; 11
sect1.para: Migrating &slepos-old; 10 to &slepos-old; 11 is done during &sls; 10 upgrade to &sls; 11. No pre-migration actions are required, but backing up of the &slepos-old; 10 system is recommended.

sect2.title: Pre-Migration Backup
sect2.para: It is highly recommended to back up your &slepos-old; 10 configuration before upgrading. On the &admserv;, backup configuration files are stored in the /etc/SLEPOS directory and the LDAP database. The LDAP database can be backed up by saving output of the slapcat command or the content of the /var/lib/ldap directory.
On the &branchserv;, only the branchserver.conf configuration file is affected by the migration procedure.

step.para: Start the installation of &sls; 11 as an upgrade from your current &sls; 10 and &slepos-old; 10 system. When asked for the installation add-on, provide the path to your &slepos-old; 11 add-on.

note.title: Network Interfaces
note.para: During the installation of &sls; 11, set up your network interfaces as specified in the &slepos-old; 10 LDAP database.

step.para: During the installation of the &slepos-old; 11 add-on, the previous &slepos-old; 10 installation is detected automatically. You will be asked to confirm the detected components or to make adjustments.
After confirming the installation, &slepos-old; 11 will be installed and configured according to the existing &slepos-old; 10 installation.

note.para: In case of any problems during migration, see /var/log/YaST2/y2log and the /var/log/messages log files.

sect1.title: Migration from &slepos-old; 11 SP3 to &slepos; 3.1
sect1.para: The migration consist of three steps:

step.para: Collect the old data from the &admserv;.

Use the &slepos; backup tool slepos_backup_data.sh to collect the old configuration, LDAP and images. To use this tool, make sure you have installed the POS_Migration package from &slepos; 11 SP3 on your old system:
Migrate the data to the &slepos; 3.1 &admserv;
Transfer the collected backup to your &slepos; 3.1 server (make sure the POS_Migration package is installed) and call slepos_migrate.sh tool:
After the migration is completed, call posAdmin --validate to make sure the LDAP database was correctly imported.
Reinitialize the &branchserv;s
&branchserv;s are not migrated, they are always initialized as new. After a &branchserv; is (re)initialized, call pos dump-all to regenerate configuration files for cash registers.

sect2.title: Upgrading &slepos-old; 11 SP3 to &slepos; 3.1
sect2.para: If you want to upgrade &slepos-old; 11 at the same time as &sls; 11 SP3, check the Include Add-On Product from Separate Media option during selection of the installation mode. You will be asked to select the &slepos; 11 SP3 installation source.

If you want to upgrade &slepos-old; 11 after the &sls; 11 SP3 upgrade, use the &yast; Add-On Products module and add &slepos; 3.1 as an add-on. Network upgrade is not supported in this scenario and results in installation failure during the second installation stage because of DNS resolving failure. You can work around this limitation by switching to a second console (F2), logging in as root and starting DNS server manually with the rcnamed start command.
During the upgrade installation, you will be asked to select a &slepos; pattern. If you do not want to change the installed pattern, click Next.

sect3.title: &slepos; Configuration After Upgrade
sect3.para: The &admserv; does not need to be configured after upgrading. Only the &branchserv; needs reconfiguration after an upgrade. The non-interactive reconfiguration is triggered via the posInitBranchserver -r -n command.
